728258f-b.title: Queens: Yellowstone Boulevard - Fleet Street
728258f-b.text:
Yellowstone Avenue (center of the view), hetueen Fleett
and Dartmouth Streets showing in the center thereof the
Richard Sprague Jr. later the Wm. Boerum house, at the S.E.
corner of Danne Flace and Exeter Street. At the right fore-
ground is the Abraham Furman house which was demolisbed in
19T3 by fire. TPe Pe-rsylvania Railroad became the owner
of all the propertv seen in 1923. View number two shows a
Clear view of the last mentioned house. It was last re-
modeled about 1859 or 1860.
Anril 1923
Views 1 a nd 2
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE RFPRODUCED.

728273f-a.title: Queens: Yellowstone Boulevard - Fleet Street
728273f-a.text:
Yellowstone Houlevard, south side, east from Fleet Street.
The peaked roof house seen in the backgrornd is partially in the
west street line of Exeter Street, just south of -ellostone
Boulevard. The street actually shown in these wievs is WYite Pot
Road which subsequently became krown as Dane Place. Tho above
named Boulevard has peen constructed at the rigt of Dane Place
and junctions it at ~oteter Street and from there absorbs it.
Ihe farmland and buildings thereon seen in this view ere a part
of Mrs. Noerum's Estate in 1873.
arch 1925.
Ehcene L. Arrhruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
728273f-a.folder: Yellowstone Boulevard & Fleet Street, Queens, NY

728272f-d.title: Queens: Yellowstone Boulevard - Fleet Street
728272f-d.text:
Yellowstone Boulevard, east side between Fleet and Exeter
Streets, showing in 4 views the William Boerum farmhouse of 1852
to 1860. Other owners were Mrs. Boerums Estate, 1873; A Miller,
1873 to 1909; Ed. England owner and subsequent occupant;
Pennsylvania Railroad, 1923, and one Weiner an occupant in 1923.
The house was still standing in Noo. 1933. See other views.
1922
View 2: April 1923
View 3: March 1925
View 4: Aum. 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
VAY BE REPRODUCED.

Yellowstone Boulevard (diagonally across the foreground when
constructed), east side, between Fleet and Exeter Streets, showing
in two views the William Boerum farmhouse grounds, and out build-
ings. See other views.
Feb. 1924
